summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated July 22, 2019, providing a rundown of recent interviews and the status of various employees, associates, and victims in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It details allegations of sexual abuse, the recruitment of minors, and the roles of Epstein's staff.

persons.name: Geoff Berman
persons.context: Recipient of the email update on the Epstein investigation from the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Friend / former girlfriend alleged to be involved in recruiting
persons.context: Her attorneys met with the prosecution team; she is assessing whether to proffer.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation; described as demanding massages, having sexual encounters with employees and minors, and making coercive statements.

connections.description: Described as a friend/former girlfriend alleged to be involved in recruiting for Epstein.
Employee-3 worked as Epstein's assistant from late 2004 to early 2006, scheduling appointments and running errands; later had sexual encounters with him.

events.title: Employee-3 meets Epstein
events.description: Employee-3 met Epstein through the modelling community while in her early 20s.

events.title: Victim recruited at age 14
events.description: A victim was recruited by an unidentified woman outside her school on the Upper East Side and began providing nude massages to Epstein for $300 each.

events.title: Epstein waits for victim to turn 18
events.description: Epstein met a 17-year-old through her sister, asked her age, and said they could not interact until she turned 18. After her birthday, he began having her give him massages.

events.title: Epinson arranges marriage
events.description: Epstein paid $10,000 to a victim to marry a girl he wanted to be able to stay in the U.S.; they married and later divorced in 2017.

locations: Private island in the Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Epstein expected two massages daily (morning and afternoon), coordinated by staff in Palm Beach and New York.
Employee-3 described two groups of girls providing massages: professional masseuses for Epstein's friends, and young, non-professional girls solely for Epstein, with indicators some were minors.
A victim estimated she may have brought as many as one hundred underage girls to Epstein's house for massages over approximately three years.
Epinson told a departing employee to 'keep your mouth shut' and remarked that 'these girls only care about money.'
During the Florida investigation, at least one victim was represented by an attorney paid by Epstein.
